Here's a summary of what I found:

---

## Files Found

### 1. Primary file (active project branch)
[.copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md](.copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md) ‚Äî **233 lines**, specific to the `_pm/copilot-core` branch. This is the actual file the symlink at `.github/instructions/` points to.

### 2. Core template
[.copilot-core/.internal/templates/agent-skills-project.instructions.md](.copilot-core/.internal/templates/agent-skills-project.instructions.md) ‚Äî **209 lines**, the base template used when bootstrapping new projects. It's slightly shorter ‚Äî missing the worktrees section and some project-specific "Refer√™ncia R√°pida" entries like `backlog` and `project-backlog-manage`.

### 3. Worktree copies (8 other project branches)
Each project worktree has its own version:
- [.copilot-project-worktrees/main/instructions/](.copilot-project-worktrees/main/instructions/) (template branch)
- [.copilot-project-worktrees/_bw/bewiser.assistant.api/instructions/](.copilot-project-worktrees/_bw/bewiser.assistant.api/instructions/)
- [.copilot-project-worktrees/_hv/STT/instructions/](.copilot-project-worktrees/_hv/STT/instructions/)

### No `workspace.instructions.md` found
No file with that exact name exists anywhere in the workspace. The project uses the naming convention `agent-skills-project.instructions.md` instead.

---

### Full content of the primary file

The file at [.copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md](.copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md) (233 lines) was read above in full. Key sections:

| Section | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| **Workspace Structure** | Maps Core vs Project repos |

| **Modos de Instala√ß√£o** | Open (submodule) vs Stealth (clone) |

| **Skills Core Dispon√≠veis (62)** | Capability manifest by type |
| **Fluxo de Carregamento** | 7-step skill loading process |
| **Estrat√©gia de Branches** | Core (main only) + Project (main + per-project branches) |
| **Worktrees** | Layout of `.copilot-project-worktrees/` |
| **Regras deste Workspace** | 8 mandatory rules |
| **Refer√™ncia R√°pida** | Natural language ‚Üí action mapping table |

The **template** at `.copilot-core/.internal/templates/` is the generic starting point; the **project file** extends it with worktree details, extra rules (7-8), and additional quick-reference entries (`backlog`, `pendente`, `guarda/lembra/registra`).

toolSpecificData.result:
Here's the full content from the `_bw/bewiser.assistant.api` branch:

---

### 1. `context/index.md` ‚Äî Does not exist

This branch uses a different structure: `context/project.md` + `context/conventions.md` instead of `index.md`. The full content of both files is shown above ‚Äî **project.md** (~180 lines) describes the project goal, stack, structure, skills available, naming conventions, and current state. **conventions.md** (~300 lines) details naming patterns per layer (API, Application, Domain, Infrastructure, Tests).

---

### 2. `skills/` directory ‚Äî 18 project skills + README

```
code-api-validate/
code-command-generate/
code-contracts-generate/
code-controller-generate/
code-entity-generate/
code-event-generate/
code-integrationtest-generate/
code-mapping-generate/
code-program-configure/
code-query-generate/
code-unittest-generate/
code-valueobject-generate/
code-webhook-generate/
infra-jwt-configure/
infra-messaging-configure/
infra-repository-generate/
infra-service-integrate/
project-scope-validate/
README.md
```

The [README.md](README.md) catalogs all 18 skills into three categories:
- **Config-only (13)** ‚Äî extend core skills with just a `config.yml`
- **Config + SKILL.md (4)** ‚Äî extend core with provider-specific instructions
- **Project-only (1)** ‚Äî `project-scope-validate`, exclusive to this project

---

### 3. Sample SKILL.md ‚Äî `infra-repository-generate`

The full SKILL.md (~200 lines) provides BeWiser-specific repository examples using **Dapper + SQL Server**, including:
- Complete `ConversationRepository` implementation with CRUD + list with paging
- All SQL scripts (GetById, GetByPhoneNumber, Insert, Update, ListWithCount for Conversations; GetById, ListByConversation, Insert for Messages)
- `TypeHandler` implementations for Value Objects (`PhoneNumberVO`, `MessageContentVO`)

Its companion `config.yml` defines the database provider, entities, table names, repository classes, script names, and type handlers in a structured format.

# Project Context

Estado atual do projeto para refer√™ncia do Copilot.

---

## Objetivo

**BeWiser.Assistant** √© um assistente de IA para WhatsApp que:
- Recebe mensagens via webhook do Twilio
- Processa via Azure OpenAI (com suporte a m√∫ltiplos modelos)
- Devolve respostas ao usu√°rio

### Caracter√≠sticas Principais

- **Multi-tenant:** Suporte a m√∫ltiplos clientes
- **M√∫ltiplos assistentes/personas:** Configur√°veis por tenant
- **RAG:** Busca em documentos para respostas contextualizadas
- **Function Calling:** Integra√ß√£o com a√ß√µes externas
- **Processamento ass√≠ncrono:** Filas via Azure Service Bus

### Exemplos de Assistentes

| Tipo | Descri√ß√£o | Capacidades |
|------|-----------|-------------|
| **Agenda Dentista** | Gerencia agenda de consult√≥rio | Marcar/remarcar consultas, lembretes |
| **Representante Comercial** | Auxilia vendas | Pedidos, ordens de compra |    
| **Assistente Pessoal** | Organiza√ß√£o pessoal | Agenda, atividades, lembretes |
| **Especialista** | Tira d√∫vidas | Responder perguntas do dom√≠nio |

## Escopo do Projeto

> **IMPORTANTE**: Se solicitada funcionalidade fora do escopo, questionar antes de implementar.

### ‚úÖ Dentro do Escopo

- API para gerenciar assistentes e tenants
- Integra√ß√£o com WhatsApp (Twilio)
- Configura√ß√£o de capacidades por assistente
- Gerenciamento de conversas
- Processamento de linguagem natural (Azure OpenAI)
- Multi-tenancy

### ‚ùå Fora do Escopo

- Interface web para usu√°rios finais
- Outros canais (Telegram, SMS)

## Stack

| Componente | Tecnologia |

# Coding Conventions

Conven√ß√µes de c√≥digo do projeto SHY HubAI (.NET / Clean Architecture).

## Naming

| Elemento | Padr√£o | Exemplo |
|----------|--------|---------|
| Classes | PascalCase | `HubAiService` |
| Interfaces | I + PascalCase | `IHubAiService` |
| M√©todos | PascalCase | `ProcessAutomation()` |
| Vari√°veis | camelCase | `automationResult` |
| Constantes | PascalCase | `MaxRetryCount` |
| Propriedades | PascalCase | `IsEnabled` |
| Par√¢metros | camelCase | `requestPayload` |
| Async methods | Sufixo Async | `ProcessAsync()` |

## Organiza√ß√£o por Camada

| Camada | Namespace raiz | Conte√∫do |
|--------|---------------|----------|
| Domain | `*.Domain` | Entidades, VOs, interfaces |
| Application | `*.Application` | Commands, Queries, Handlers, DTOs |
| Infrastructure | `*.Infrastructure` | Implementa√ß√µes, integra√ß√µes AI |
| API | `*.Api` | Controllers, Middlewares, Config |

## Regras

1. Uma classe por arquivo
2. Nome do arquivo = nome da classe
3. Interfaces no Domain, implementa√ß√µes no Infrastructure
4. DTOs no Application, nunca no Domain
5. Sem l√≥gica de neg√≥cio em Controllers
'@ | Set-Content -Path "skills\coding-conventions\SKILL.md" -Encoding utf8

@'

  version: "1.0"

# Clean Architecture Pattern

Regras de estrutura e depend√™ncia do projeto SHY HubAI.

## Camadas e Depend√™ncias

- **Domain** n√£o depende de nada
- **Application** depende apenas de Domain
- **Infrastructure** implementa interfaces de Domain/Application
- **API** orquestra via DI

## Onde Colocar Cada Artefato

| Artefato | Camada | Exemplo |
|----------|--------|---------|
| Entidade | Domain | `Automation.cs` |
| Value Object | Domain | `AutomationId.cs` |
| Interface de Reposit√≥rio | Domain | `IAutomationRepository.cs` |
| Interface de Servi√ßo | Application | `IAutomationService.cs` |
| Command/Query | Application | `ProcessAutomationCommand.cs` |
| Handler | Application | `ProcessAutomationHandler.cs` |
| DTO | Application | `AutomationDto.cs` |
| Reposit√≥rio concreto | Infrastructure | `AutomationRepository.cs` |
| Integra√ß√£o externa | Infrastructure | `OpenAiProvider.cs` |
| Controller | API | `AutomationController.cs` |
| Middleware | API | `ErrorHandlingMiddleware.cs` |

## Workflow para Nova Feature

1. Definir entidades/VOs no **Domain**
2. Criar interfaces no **Domain**
3. Criar Commands/Queries + Handlers no **Application**
4. Implementar reposit√≥rios/servi√ßos no **Infrastructure**
5. Expor via Controller na **API**
6. Registrar DI no **API** (ou Infrastructure DI extension)

## Regras

- NUNCA referenciar Infrastructure no Domain
- NUNCA colocar l√≥gica de neg√≥cio em Controllers
- Commands para escrita, Queries para leitura
- Um Handler por Command/Query

Modo Stealth (clone + gitignore) ‚Äî PowerShell ```powershell git clone -b main https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-core.git .copilot-core git clone -b _sk/shy.hubai https://github.com/pdmartins/.copilot-project.git .copilot-project mkdir .github\instructions -Force cmd /c mklink ".github\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md" "..\..\..copilot-core\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md" cmd /c mklink ".github\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md" "..\..\..copilot-project\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md" Add-Content .gitignore "`n# Copilot Agent Skills (local only)`n.copilot-core/`n.copilot-project/`n.github/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md`n.github/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md" git add .gitignore git commit -m "chore: gitignore copilot agent local files" ```
--- **Resumo do que ser√° criado:** | Item | Caminho | |------|---------| | Branch | `_sk/shy.hubai` | | Contexto | `context/index.md` + 3 subpastas preenchidas | | Mem√≥ria | `memory/index.md` (vazio) | | Skills | `coding-conventions`, `clean-arch-pattern` | | Worktree | `.copilot-project-worktrees/_sk/shy.hubai/` | Ap√≥s plugar no projeto-alvo, execute `project-structure-analyze` para refinar o contexto com base no c√≥digo real.

description: Cria e configura um novo projeto completo a partir do workspace .copilot-core. Coleta contexto profundo, cria branch no .copilot-project com contexto, mem√≥ria e skills espec√≠ficos preenchidos, e fornece script para plugar no projeto-alvo. Recomendado usar com Plan mode. Triggers - criar projeto, novo projeto, onboard projeto, preparar projeto, registrar projeto.
Cria e configura um novo projeto **completo** a partir do workspace .copilot-core/.copilot-project.
> **üí° Usar com Plan mode** ‚Äî Este skill envolve muitas decis√µes (skills a criar, contexto a preencher, estrutura). O Plan mode permite que o usu√°rio revise tudo antes de executar.
- Usu√°rio est√° neste workspace e quer preparar um novo projeto
- Quer que branch, contexto, skills e mem√≥ria j√° estejam prontos antes de plugar
2. Definir skills espec√≠ficos             12. git add && commit
**ANTES de qualquer outra coisa**, perguntar ao usu√°rio:
> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Este skill funciona melhor em Plan mode**, que permite revisar contexto, skills propostos e estrutura antes de executar.
> Voc√™ est√° usando **Plan mode**? Se n√£o, recomendo trocar antes de continuar:
> - No Copilot Chat, mude o modo para **Plan** (√≠cone ao lado do campo de input)
**Se o usu√°rio confirmar que est√° em Plan mode** ‚Üí continuar.
**Se o usu√°rio quiser continuar em Agent mode** ‚Üí prosseguir, mas avisar que n√£o poder√° revisar o plano antes da execu√ß√£o.
Entrevista conversacional **aprofundada**. N√£o pular etapas ‚Äî quanto mais contexto, melhor o agente funciona no projeto-alvo.
1. **Nome** ‚Äî ser√° o nome da branch (sugerir kebab-case)
2. **Resumo** ‚Äî o que o projeto faz, para quem, qual problema resolve
14. **Dom√≠nio** ‚Äî termos espec√≠ficos do neg√≥cio que o agente deve conhecer
> **Nota:** Adaptar as perguntas ao contexto. Se o usu√°rio diz "√© um CLI em Go", n√£o perguntar sobre banco de dados. Ser inteligente sobre o que √© relevante.
Com base nas respostas, **propor skills** para o `.copilot-project/skills/`:
- 1 skill de padr√£o de c√≥digo (coding conventions do projeto)
> **Apresentar ao usu√°rio a lista de skills propostos para aprova√ß√£o antes de criar.** No Plan mode, isso acontece naturalmente.
- **Se existir**: Avisar e perguntar se deseja sobrescrever
Popular subpastas de contexto com as informa√ß√µes coletadas ‚Äî **conte√∫do rico**, n√£o template gen√©rico:
1. **context/index.md** ‚Äî Resumo do projeto, stack principal, fase, √∫ltima atualiza√ß√£o
2. **context/infrastructure/{slug}.md** ‚Äî Stack completa (linguagem, framework, DB, infra, build tools)
3. **context/architecture/{slug}.md** ‚Äî Descri√ß√£o da arquitetura, estrutura de pastas, componentes principais
4. **context/conventions/{slug}.md** ‚Äî Code style, git flow, estrat√©gia de testes
5. **context/business-rules/{slug}.md** ‚Äî Gloss√°rio de dom√≠nio, regras de neg√≥cio (se aplic√°vel)
> Preencher apenas subpastas relevantes. N√£o for√ßar pastas vazias al√©m do .gitkeep.
Para cada skill aprovado na etapa 2:
2. Criar `SKILL.md` seguindo o padr√£o Agent Skills:
- Ser **espec√≠fico** ‚Äî referenciar nomes reais de pastas, libs, padr√µes do projeto
- Incluir **exemplos** com o stack real do projeto
- Definir **triggers** claros para quando o skill deve ativar
Criar `.copilot-project/instructions/workspace.instructions.md` baseado no template `.copilot-core/.internal/templates/workspace.instructions.md`, personalizado com informa√ß√µes do projeto.
> **Nota:** Este arquivo √© armazenado no `.copilot-project/instructions/` e vinculado via symlink para `.github/instructions/` no projeto-alvo.
git commit -m "feat: configura√ß√£o inicial do projeto {nome}"
### 10. Criar worktree no workspace de desenvolvimento
Criar uma worktree para a nova branch, permitindo acesso simult√¢neo aos arquivos de todos os projetos sem trocar de branch:
- O nome do diret√≥rio da worktree **deve ser id√™ntico** ao nome da branch
- Se a branch tem `/` (ex: `_hv/STT`), criar subdiret√≥rios correspondentes (ex: `.copilot-project-worktrees/_hv/STT/`)
- Verificar com `git worktree list` que a worktree foi criada corretamente
> Isso permite compara√ß√£o direta de instru√ß√µes, contexto e skills entre projetos.
Gerar os comandos para o usu√°rio colar no terminal do projeto-alvo.
Sempre fornecer **ambas as vers√µes** (PowerShell e Bash) e **ambos os modos** (aberto e stealth).
> **Perguntar ao usu√°rio:** "O projeto permite submodules vis√≠veis no reposit√≥rio? Ou precisa ser modo stealth (invis√≠vel)?"
Para plugar no projeto, rode na raiz dele:
(incluir os scripts do template com vari√°veis preenchidas)
- **Usar Plan mode** ‚Äî permite revisar contexto, skills e estrutura antes de executar
- Este skill opera **neste workspace** (.copilot-core + .copilot-project), n√£o no projeto-alvo
- O script assume que o projeto-alvo tem Git inicializado
- Se o usu√°rio n√£o tiver acesso push ao `.copilot-project`, ele n√£o poder√° criar a branch remotamente
- Ap√≥s plugar no projeto-alvo, rodar `project-structure-analyze` para refinar com base no c√≥digo real
| M√©todo | Onde roda | O que faz |
| **project-workspace-create** | Workspace core (Plan) | Cria branch + contexto + skills + script |

Here's the full content from the `_bw/bewiser.assistant.api` branch:

---

### 1. `context/index.md` ‚Äî Does not exist

This branch uses a different structure: `context/project.md` + `context/conventions.md` instead of `index.md`. The full content of both files is shown above ‚Äî **project.md** (~180 lines) describes the project goal, stack, structure, skills available, naming conventions, and current state. **conventions.md** (~300 lines) details naming patterns per layer (API, Application, Domain, Infrastructure, Tests).

---

### 2. `skills/` directory ‚Äî 18 project skills + README

```
code-api-validate/
code-command-generate/
code-contracts-generate/
code-controller-generate/
code-entity-generate/
code-event-generate/
code-integrationtest-generate/
code-mapping-generate/
code-program-configure/
code-query-generate/
code-unittest-generate/
code-valueobject-generate/
code-webhook-generate/
infra-jwt-configure/
infra-messaging-configure/
infra-repository-generate/
infra-service-integrate/
project-scope-validate/
README.md
```

The [README.md](README.md) catalogs all 18 skills into three categories:
- **Config-only (13)** ‚Äî extend core skills with just a `config.yml`
- **Config + SKILL.md (4)** ‚Äî extend core with provider-specific instructions
- **Project-only (1)** ‚Äî `project-scope-validate`, exclusive to this project

---

### 3. Sample SKILL.md ‚Äî `infra-repository-generate`

The full SKILL.md (~200 lines) provides BeWiser-specific repository examples using **Dapper + SQL Server**, including:
- Complete `ConversationRepository` implementation with CRUD + list with paging
- All SQL scripts (GetById, GetByPhoneNumber, Insert, Update, ListWithCount for Conversations; GetById, ListByConversation, Insert for Messages)
- `TypeHandler` implementations for Value Objects (`PhoneNumberVO`, `MessageContentVO`)

Its companion `config.yml` defines the database provider, entities, table names, repository classes, script names, and type handlers in a structured format.

# Coding Conventions

Conven√ß√µes de c√≥digo do projeto SHY HubAI (.NET / Clean Architecture).

## Naming

| Elemento | Padr√£o | Exemplo |
|----------|--------|---------|
| Classes | PascalCase | `HubAiService` |
| Interfaces | I + PascalCase | `IHubAiService` |
| M√©todos | PascalCase | `ProcessAutomation()` |
| Vari√°veis | camelCase | `automationResult` |
| Constantes | PascalCase | `MaxRetryCount` |
| Propriedades | PascalCase | `IsEnabled` |
| Par√¢metros | camelCase | `requestPayload` |
| Async methods | Sufixo Async | `ProcessAsync()` |

## Organiza√ß√£o por Camada

| Camada | Namespace raiz | Conte√∫do |
|--------|---------------|----------|
| Domain | `*.Domain` | Entidades, VOs, interfaces |
| Application | `*.Application` | Commands, Queries, Handlers, DTOs |
| Infrastructure | `*.Infrastructure` | Implementa√ß√µes, integra√ß√µes AI |
| API | `*.Api` | Controllers, Middlewares, Config |

## Regras

1. Uma classe por arquivo
2. Nome do arquivo = nome da classe
3. Interfaces no Domain, implementa√ß√µes no Infrastructure
4. DTOs no Application, nunca no Domain
5. Sem l√≥gica de neg√≥cio em Controllers
'@ | Set-Content -Path "skills\coding-conventions\SKILL.md" -Encoding utf8
```

### 3.10 ‚Äî

```powershell

description: Padr√µes de Clean Architecture do projeto SHY HubAI. Estrutura de camadas, regras de depend√™ncia, onde colocar cada tipo de artefato. Triggers - criar feature, nova funcionalidade, onde colocar, qual camada, estrutura.
metadata:
  author: shy.hubai
  version: "1.0"
  category: code
---

# Clean Architecture Pattern

Regras de estrutura e depend√™ncia do projeto SHY HubAI.

## Camadas e Depend√™ncias

```
API ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Domain ‚Üê Infrastructure
```

- **Domain** n√£o depende de nada
- **Application** depende apenas de Domain
- **Infrastructure** implementa interfaces de Domain/Application
- **API** orquestra via DI

## Onde Colocar Cada Artefato

| Artefato | Camada | Exemplo |
|----------|--------|---------|
| Entidade | Domain | `Automation.cs` |
| Value Object | Domain | `AutomationId.cs` |
| Interface de Reposit√≥rio | Domain | `IAutomationRepository.cs` |
| Interface de Servi√ßo | Application | `IAutomationService.cs` |
| Command/Query | Application | `ProcessAutomationCommand.cs` |
| Handler | Application | `ProcessAutomationHandler.cs` |
| DTO | Application | `AutomationDto.cs` |
| Reposit√≥rio concreto | Infrastructure | `AutomationRepository.cs` |
| Integra√ß√£o externa | Infrastructure | `OpenAiProvider.cs` |
| Controller | API | `AutomationController.cs` |
| Middleware | API | `ErrorHandlingMiddleware.cs` |

## Workflow para Nova Feature

1. Definir entidades/VOs no **Domain**
2. Criar interfaces no **Domain**
3. Criar Commands/Queries + Handlers no **Application**
4. Implementar reposit√≥rios/servi√ßos no **Infrastructure**
5. Expor via Controller na **API**
6. Registrar DI no **API** (ou Infrastructure DI extension)

## Regras

- NUNCA referenciar Infrastructure no Domain
- NUNCA colocar l√≥gica de neg√≥cio em Controllers
- Commands para escrita, Queries para leitura
- Um Handler por Command/Query
'@ | Set-Content -Path "skills\clean-arch-pattern\SKILL.md" -Encoding utf8
```

# Coding Conventions

Conven√ß√µes de c√≥digo do projeto SHY HubAI (.NET / Clean Architecture).

## Naming

| Elemento | Padr√£o | Exemplo |
|----------|--------|---------|
| Classes | PascalCase | `HubAiService` |
| Interfaces | I + PascalCase | `IHubAiService` |
| M√©todos | PascalCase | `ProcessAutomation()` |
| Vari√°veis | camelCase | `automationResult` |
| Constantes | PascalCase | `MaxRetryCount` |
| Propriedades | PascalCase | `IsEnabled` |
| Par√¢metros | camelCase | `requestPayload` |
| Async methods | Sufixo Async | `ProcessAsync()` |

## Organiza√ß√£o por Camada

| Camada | Namespace raiz | Conte√∫do |
|--------|---------------|----------|
| Domain | `*.Domain` | Entidades, VOs, interfaces |
| Application | `*.Application` | Commands, Queries, Handlers, DTOs |
| Infrastructure | `*.Infrastructure` | Implementa√ß√µes, integra√ß√µes AI |
| API | `*.Api` | Controllers, Middlewares, Config |

## Regras

1. Uma classe por arquivo
2. Nome do arquivo = nome da classe
3. Interfaces no Domain, implementa√ß√µes no Infrastructure
4. DTOs no Application, nunca no Domain
5. Sem l√≥gica de neg√≥cio em Controllers

# Clean Architecture Pattern

Regras de estrutura e depend√™ncia do projeto SHY HubAI.

## Camadas e Depend√™ncias

```
API ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Domain ‚Üê Infrastructure
```

- **Domain** n√£o depende de nada
- **Application** depende apenas de Domain
- **Infrastructure** implementa interfaces de Domain/Application
- **API** orquestra via DI

## Onde Colocar Cada Artefato

| Artefato | Camada | Exemplo |
|----------|--------|---------|
| Entidade | Domain | `Automation.cs` |
| Value Object | Domain | `AutomationId.cs` |
| Interface de Reposit√≥rio | Domain | `IAutomationRepository.cs` |
| Interface de Servi√ßo | Application | `IAutomationService.cs` |
| Command/Query | Application | `ProcessAutomationCommand.cs` |
| Handler | Application | `ProcessAutomationHandler.cs` |
| DTO | Application | `AutomationDto.cs` |
| Reposit√≥rio concreto | Infrastructure | `AutomationRepository.cs` |
| Integra√ß√£o externa | Infrastructure | `OpenAiProvider.cs` |
| Controller | API | `AutomationController.cs` |
| Middleware | API | `ErrorHandlingMiddleware.cs` |

## Workflow para Nova Feature

1. Definir entidades/VOs no **Domain**
2. Criar interfaces no **Domain**
3. Criar Commands/Queries + Handlers no **Application**
4. Implementar reposit√≥rios/servi√ßos no **Infrastructure**
5. Expor via Controller na **API**
6. Registrar DI no **API** (ou Infrastructure DI extension)

## Regras

- NUNCA referenciar Infrastructure no Domain
- NUNCA colocar l√≥gica de neg√≥cio em Controllers
- Commands para escrita, Queries para leitura
- Um Handler por Command/Query

<attachment id="file:setup-instructions.ps1" filePath="d:\\Repos\\_pm\\copilot\\.copilot-core\\.internal\\config\\setup-instructions.ps1">
# Setup Instructions - Copilot Agent Skills
# Corrige symlinks quebrados em .github/instructions/
# Pode ser executado da raiz do projeto OU de dentro de .copilot-core/config/

# Detectar se estamos em .copilot-core/config e ajustar o diret√≥rio
$currentDir = Get-Location
if ($currentDir.Path -match '\.copilot-core\\config$') {
    Write-Host "üìç Detectado execu√ß√£o de dentro de .copilot-core/config" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host "   Mudando para raiz do projeto..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Set-Location "../.."
}

Write-Host "üîß Corrigindo symlinks do Copilot Agent..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

# Verificar se estamos na raiz de um projeto com .copilot-core e .copilot-project
if (!(Test-Path ".copilot-core") -or !(Test-Path ".copilot-project")) {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Erro: .copilot-core ou .copilot-project n√£o encontrados" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "   Execute este script na raiz do projeto que cont√©m os submodules/clones" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
}

# Verificar se os arquivos de destino existem
if (!(Test-Path ".copilot-core\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md")) {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Erro: .copilot-core\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md n√£o encontrado" -ForegroundColor Red
    exit 1
}

if (!(Test-Path ".copilot-project\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md")) {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Erro: .copilot-project\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md n√£o encontrado" -ForegroundColor Red
    exit 1
}

# Criar diret√≥rio se n√£o existe
if (!(Test-Path ".github\instructions")) {
    Write-Host "üìÅ Criando .github\instructions..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path ".github\instructions" -Force | Out-Null
}

# Remover symlinks antigos/quebrados
Write-Host "üóëÔ∏è  Removendo symlinks antigos..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
Remove-Item ".github\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Remove-Item ".github\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

# Obter caminhos absolutos
$coreTarget = Resolve-Path ".copilot-core\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md"
$projectTarget = Resolve-Path ".copilot-project\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md"

# Criar novos symlinks
Write-Host "üîó Criando symlinks corretos..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

try {
    New-Item -ItemType SymbolicLink -Path ".github\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md" -Target $coreTarget -Force | Out-Null
    New-Item -ItemType SymbolicLink -Path ".github\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md" -Target $projectTarget -Force | Out-Null
    
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Symlinks criados com sucesso!" -ForegroundColor Green
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "Verifica√ß√£o:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    Get-Item ".github\instructions\*" | Select-Object Name, LinkType, @{Name="Target";Expression={$_.Target}} | Format-Table -AutoSize
    
    # Testar se os symlinks est√£o acess√≠veis
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "Testando acessibilidade:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    $coreOk = Test-Path ".github\instructions\agent-skills-core.instructions.md"
    $projectOk = Test-Path ".github\instructions\agent-skills-project.instructions.md"
    
    if ($coreOk -and $projectOk) {
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Ambos os symlinks est√£o acess√≠veis" -ForegroundColor Green
    } else {
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Alguns symlinks podem n√£o estar acess√≠veis:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "   agent-skills-core.instructions.md: $(if($coreOk){'‚úÖ'}else{'‚ùå'})" -ForegroundColor $(if($coreOk){'Green'}else{'Red'})
        Write-Host "   agent-skills-project.instructions.md: $(if($projectOk){'‚úÖ'}else{'‚ùå'})" -ForegroundColor $(if($projectOk){'Green'}else{'Red'})
    }
    
} catch {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Erro ao criar symlinks: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "   Certifique-se de executar o PowerShell como Administrador" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
}

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Setup Instructions - Copilot Agent Skills
# Corrige symlinks quebrados em .github/instructions/
# Pode ser executado da raiz do projeto OU de dentro de .copilot-core/config/

set -e

# Detectar se estamos em .copilot-core/config e ajustar o diret√≥rio
if [[ "$PWD" == *".copilot-core/config" ]]; then
    echo "üìç Detectado execu√ß√£o de dentro de .copilot-core/config"
    echo "   Mudando para raiz do projeto..."
    cd ../..
fi

echo "üîß Corrigindo symlinks do Copilot Agent..."

# Verificar se estamos na raiz de um projeto com .copilot-core e .copilot-project
if [ ! -d ".copilot-core" ] || [ ! -d ".copilot-project" ]; then
    echo "‚ùå Erro: .copilot-core ou .copilot-project n√£o encontrados"
    echo "   Execute este script na raiz do projeto que cont√©m os submodules/clones"
    exit 1
fi

# Verificar se os arquivos de destino existem
if [ ! -f ".copilot-core/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md" ]; then
    echo "‚ùå Erro: .copilot-core/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md n√£o encontrado"
    exit 1
fi

if [ ! -f ".copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md" ]; then
    echo "‚ùå Erro: .copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md n√£o encontrado"
    exit 1
fi

# Criar diret√≥rio se n√£o existe
if [ ! -d ".github/instructions" ]; then
    echo "üìÅ Criando .github/instructions..."
    mkdir -p .github/instructions
fi

# Remover symlinks antigos/quebrados
echo "üóëÔ∏è  Removendo symlinks antigos..."
rm -f .github/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md
rm -f .github/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md

# Criar novos symlinks com caminhos relativos
echo "üîó Criando symlinks corretos..."
ln -s ../../.copilot-core/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md .github/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md
ln -s ../../.copilot-project/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md .github/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md

echo "‚úÖ Symlinks criados com sucesso!"
echo ""
echo "Verifica√ß√£o:"
ls -la .github/instructions/

# Testar se os symlinks est√£o acess√≠veis
echo ""
echo "Testando acessibilidade:"
if [ -f ".github/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md" ] && [ -f ".github/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md" ]; then
    echo "‚úÖ Ambos os symlinks est√£o acess√≠veis"
else
    echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Alguns symlinks podem n√£o estar acess√≠veis:"
    [ -f ".github/instructions/agent-skills-core.instructions.md" ] && echo "   agent-skills-core.instructions.md: ‚úÖ" || echo "   agent-skills-core.instructions.md: ‚ùå"
    [ -f ".github/instructions/agent-skills-project.instructions.md" ] && echo "   agent-skills-project.instructions.md: ‚úÖ" || echo "   agent-skills-project.instructions.md: ‚ùå"
fi
</attachment>
